column4: removable devices are best managed by the gnome-volume-manager -- and entries in fstab are usually only processed on startup -- anyway. you can look into a udev-rule to force your device to be something like /dev/ipod
gnome should usually always mount your ipod in /media/<ipodsname> .. unless the directory already exists (from a previous improper unmount)
under /etc/udev -- probably one of the files under /etc/udev/rules.d/
